column4: why can't you install new versions of software in Ubuntu, or any other Linux distro?
you can.. what are you looking for?
that's not quite true, if you try to install gimp 2.8 on ubuntu 10.04, I'm pretty sure it will not work

you have a couple of ways.  First is to compile it yourself making a .deb to install or google for "gimp PPA".  PPA's are unsupported program space where someone else has compiled the program for specific versions of ubuntu.. the ppa is installed as part of your package manager and the program(s) in it are then available through the normal package manager.
